profile.name: Kees Cook
profile.bio: Free Software Hacker | Exploring the intersection of #AI, security & open source. Sharing learning, hot takes, and code from Portland, OR. 💻🤖

tweets.content: Deep dive into `seccomp` filters today. Realizing the nuanced power for process sandboxing. Thinking about a new project integrating this more robustly. #LinuxSecurity #eBPF
Excited to see the discussions around the new Rust in Linux kernel RFCs picking up steam. Gradual adoption, smart choices. This is how FOSS evolves. #LinuxKernel #RustLang
Had a great discussion with some folks about the future of open hardware and software integration. The synergy is profound, especially in security. #OpenHardware #FOSS
The 'move fast and break things' mantra always felt irresponsible in critical infrastructure. For free software, it's 'move carefully and improve things, together.' #FOSSphilosophy
Exploring some advanced `ptrace` techniques for a custom debugger. The syscall interface might be raw, but the power it grants is unparalleled for system-level introspection. #LowLevel #Linux
Just spent an hour fixing a bug only to realize it was in a dependency I installed 3 years ago and forgot about. The true 'supply chain' attack.

Are we over-abstracting everything? Sometimes, a simple, well-written script is far more maintainable and auditable than a complex framework with 100 dependencies. Discuss. #SoftwareDesign #Simplicity
Just pushed a patch for `libvirt` addressing a minor memory leak in the network config parsing. Small fix, but every byte counts! #OpenSource #CProgramming

Saw a tweet about new proprietary 'AI-powered' dev tools. My take: fantastic for quick prototypes, but for anything critical, I'm sticking with tools I can audit, modify, and *understand*. Transparency matters. #FreeSoftware
Another day, another 'cloud-native' stack that needs 15 layers of abstraction just to run a hello world. Give me a well-documented C library and a `make` file any day. #FOSS #KeepItSimple
Reading about the new vulnerabilities found in a popular commercial OS. Reinforces why open source, with its eyes of many, is often inherently more secure in the long run. #AuditabilityMatters
My code doesn't have bugs, it just has features that are currently under-documented and awaiting a full specification. #DevelopersLife
My `git stash` is basically an archive of all the brilliant ideas I had at 2 AM that turned out to be terrible by morning. #devhumor #git
Huge shoutout to the maintainers of `systemd-boot` for their quick response on my recent bug report. Community collaboration is what makes FOSS thrive! #Linux #OpenSourceCommunity
Just managed to compile and run my custom kernel module on a Raspberry Pi. Tiny victories fuel the soul. Now to get it to actually *do* something useful. #EmbeddedLinux #KernelDev
Wrestling with a tricky race condition in a multi-threaded C application. Nothing beats staring at logs and `gdb` for hours. Send caffeine. #DebuggingLife
Finished up a deep security review on an embedded Linux system this week. Always fascinating to peel back the layers and find those hidden corners. #InfoSec #Embedded
Unpopular opinion: If your 'microservice' architecture requires 10 different YAML files just to deploy locally, you've optimized for complexity, not agility. #DevOps #KISS
